utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brought you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, um so I've had this terrible fever for the past three days um and just before that I had a stuffy nose um and I had a sore throat, well I still do, um and it's just not going away, so I thought I should just come in and see if I have covid or what it is.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so if I understand, it started with a stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and that kinda progressed to a fever?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you been feeling any other symptoms aside from the fever?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Nothing really, have you had any nausea, any vomiting at all in the last little while?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any pain anywhere else in your body?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you have any neck stiffness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, no headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been able to eat and drink during this time period?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Excellent. OK, you've had a cough at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No cough, OK and then how about abdominal pain, any pain in your tummy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Nothing like that, what about other changes in your body? Have you noticed any fevers or any rashes, any skin changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. What about any pain in any of your joints and your knees, hips?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, actually um not in my joints, but I've just, there there has been some muscle ache.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how long has that been going on for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh for the past two three days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So around the same time that you've had this fever?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Now have you had any contact with anyone who's been sick in the last little while?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, not that I can think of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any recent travel anywhere else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I did go hiking um last weekend, um and it was about 2 hours away, um there were some people on the hiking trail that I passed by, but um other than that, no travel outside the province.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Does anyone around you or in your immediate circle come down with anything similar recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um my husband has also been experiencing similar symptoms for the past week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how's he doing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh the same as me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any covid swabs recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and aside from the weekend hike, have you been mainly self isolating or?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, just me and my husband at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you leave the house for work at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I work from home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sounds good. So you have some muscle aches, little bit of fever, stuffy nose, sore throat, do you have any difficulty swallowing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, it just hurts.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you're still able to swallow food, swallow liquids?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It doesn't feel like anything is going down the wrong way or have any coughing after you swallow?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And just in terms of coming back to this sore throat, do you feel like you have any swelling around your neck? Does it feel inflamed or swollen?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Nothing like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, excellent. So you're eating well, doing well, any changes to your bowel movements recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, I'll just kind of go into other things, just in terms of anything else that you might have had in the past, uh have you ever been hospitalized for any reason in your life?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I had my gallbladder taken out five years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so that was around when you were 50 years old?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And any other surgeries you've had in your life?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, anything you've had to see a doctor for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I, in the past couple of years uh just for things like like this I guess um colds, um I'm pre diabetic, so I've been checking my glucose levels, yeah other than that nothing else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So no high blood pressure?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No cholesterol issues?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it sounds like you've been pretty healthy otherwise.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Excellent, OK. Do you have any allergies? To medications or otherwise.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Penicillin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Penicillin, what happens when you take penicillin?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I get a rash.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any trouble breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And what medications, if any, are you on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I'm, I just take multivitamins, that's it though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And you said you lived with your husband in a house, um in London?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What do you two do for work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I work from home as a digital marketing agent and my husband is a computer programmer.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I drink once once in a while.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And when you drink, how many drinks do you have?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um about one or two glasses of wine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Got it. Any other recreational drugs, substances?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So no marijuana, heroin, cocaine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've tried marijuana before, just like edibles, but not, not regularly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Understood. And have you ever used IV drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when was your last menstrual period?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It was um a year ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: A year ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And then otherwise, so we talked a little bit about recent travel. It sounds like you have the hiking trip last week and you passed some people, but it sounds like your husband also has kind of similar symptoms that you do right now.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sounds good, now we've already talked about kind of past medical issues. Moving on, I think what we'll do next is move on to a physical exam. But before I do that, do you have any questions for me? Anything else you feel I should know?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, do you think I have covid?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It's a possibility. It's always good to rule these things out, so we'll be ordering a covid swab no matter what. Obviously with any presentation where we have someone come in with a fever and sore throat, we want to rule out anything infectious. So it sounds like if your husband got it, and you have it, covid would be our first thing that we want to rule out. So just while we're trying to investigate, work this up further, I want to have you and your husband self isolate. The other question I suppose I should ask is, have you gotten your flu shot this year?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So it's also a possibility it might be influenza, just the seasonal flu. But until we, I suppose rule out covid, it'd be best just to keep to yourself just in case you are infectious for the meanwhile.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, well I'm going to go talk to the Doctor and I'll be coming back in to see you, OK?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Alright, great thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
